contents.content1:
If you know base method you will be able to square any no. within seconds.
All the other methods are just an exaggeration of this base method. If you clearly understand this one, I bet other methods will be very simple to you.
The base Square method is known as 'Yavadunam Thavaunikrutya Vargamca Yojayet Sutram' but you don't need to memorize this horrible name. Just learn the method.
The method say:- There are three bases in Vedic mathematics 10, 100 and 1000. Choose the base which is nearby to the number.
There are two cases explained in Examples:-
Case I (Using Actual Base)
Case II (Using Convenient Base)

examples.example1:
Case I (Using Actual Base)
13X13=169
Number = 13, Actual Base=10
Step 1:- Find the difference between number and actual base: 13-10=3

Step 2:- Square the difference: 3X3=9

Step 3:- Add difference to the original no.; 13+3=16

Step 4:- Put both the numbers together 169

Note:- For actual base 10 take only unit's digit from step 2, extra digits will be carry forwarded. For actual base 100 take last 2 digits from step 2, extra digits will be carry forwarded.

examples.example2:
Case II (Using Convenient Base)
34X34 = 1156
For some cases no. is too far from actual base, so it is difficult to find square of difference, there we can use convenient base method:-
Number = 34 Actual Base=10 Convenient Base=30
Step 1:- Find the difference between number and convenient base i.e. 34-30=4

Step 2:- Square the difference i.e. 4X4=16

Step 3:- Add difference to the original number i.e. 34+4=38

Step 4:- Find the ratio between convenient base and actual base i.e. 30/10= 3

Step 5:- Multiply this ratio to number obtained from step 2 i.e. 38X3=114

Step 6:- Carry forward the extra digit from step 2 and put both nos. together i.e. 114+1/6 is 1156

Note:- For actual base 10 take only unit’s digit from step 2, extra digits will be carry forwarded. For actual base 100 take last 2 digits from step 2, extra digits will be carry forwarded.

contents.content1:
54X54=2916
Step 1:- Add unit's digit to 25 i.e. 25+4 = 29

Step 2:- Square unit's digit i.e. 4X4=16

Step 3:- Put both the numbers together i.e. 2916

Note:- If no. obtained from step 2 is less than 10 than put a zero before it.

examples.example1:
Suppose we want to find the square of 53
Step 1:- Add unit's digit to 25 i.e. 25+3 = 28

Step 2:- Square unit's digit i.e. 3X3=09

Step 3:- Put both the numbers together i.e. 2809

examples.example2:
Suppose we want to find the square of 59
Step 1:- Add unit's digit to 25 i.e. 25+9 = 34

Step 2:- Square unit's digit i.e. 9X9=81

Step 3:- Put both the numbers together i.e. 3481

topic: Square of a number between 10 to 19

contents.content1:
13X13=169
Step 1:- Add unit's digit to no. itself i.e. 13+3 = 16

Step 2:- Square unit's digit i.e. 3X3 = 9

Step 3:- Put both the numbers together i.e.169

Note:- If square of unit's digit is 2 digit no. than carry forward extra digit to left hand side.

examples.example1:
Suppose we want to find the square of 18
Step 1:- Add unit's digit to no. itself i.e. 18+8 = 26

Step 2:- Square unit's digit i.e. 8X8 = 64

Step 3:- As square of unit's digit is 2 digit no. so extra digit '6' will be carry forwarded: 26+6=32

Step 4:- Put remaining digit together i.e. 324.

examples.example2:
Suppose we want to find the square of 99
Here number of 9's are 2
Step 1:-So we will write 999... upto (2-1) 1 time, followed by 8 i.e. 98

Step 2:- Than write '0' upto (2-1) 1 time followed by 1 = 9801

topic: Square of a number close to 100

contents.content1:
96X96=9216
Step 1:- Subtract 100 from number: 96-100=-4

Step 2:- Square the difference obtained from step 1 i.e. -4X-4=16

Step 3:- Add the difference to the original no. i.e. 96-4=92

Step 4:- Put both the numbers together i.e. 9216

Note:- If no. obtained from step 2 is less than 10 than put a zero before it.

examples.example1:
Suppose we want to find the square of 102
Step 1:- Subtract 100 from number i.e. 102-100=2

Step 2:- Square the difference obtained from step 1 i.e. 2X2=04

Step 3:- Add the difference to the original no. i.e. 102+2=104

Step 4:- Put both the numbers together i.e. 10404

examples.example2:
Suppose we want to find the square of 107
Step 1:- Subtract 100 from number i.e. 107-100=7

Step 2:- Square the difference obtained from step 1 i.e. 7X7=49

Step 3:- Add the difference to the original no. i.e. 107+7=114

Step 4:- Put both the numbers together i.e. 11449

topic: Square of a number containing only '9'

contents.content1:
999X999=998001
Step 1:- Find no. of 9's in given number = 3

Step 2:- Write '9' upto n-1 times, followed by single digit '8'= 998

Step 3:- Than Write '0' upto n-1 times, followed by single digit '1' = 998001

examples.example1:
Suppose we want to find the square of 9999
Here number of 9's are 4
Step 1:- So we will write 999... upto (4-1) 3 times, followed by 8 is 9998

Step 2:- Than write '0' upto (4-1) 3 times followed by 1 = 99980001

examples.example2:
Suppose we want to find the square of 99
Hhere number of 9's are 2
Step 1:- So we will write 999... upto (2-1) 1 time, followed by 8 is 98

Step 2:- Than write '0' upto (2-1) 1 time followed by 1 = 9801

topic: Square of a number containing only '1'

contents.content1:
111X111=12321
Step 1:- Find no. of 1's in given number = 3

Step 2:- Write 1234... upto number of 1's in given number in ascending order = 123

Step 3:- Than write descending nos. upto 1, next to previous no. = 12321

examples.example1:
Suppose we want to find the square of 1111
ere number of 1's are 4
Step 1:- So we will write 123...n upto 4 is 1234

Step 2:- Than we will write nos. in descending order, next to previous no. = 1234321

examples.example2:
Suppose we want to find the square of 11
Here number of 1’s are 2
Step 1:- PSo we will write 123...n upto 2 is 12

Step 2:- Than we will write nos. in descending order, next to previous no. = 121

topic: Square of a Number ending in 5

contents.content1:
65X65=4225
Step 1:- Multiply the left part/digit to the left part/digit plus one: 6X (6+1) =42

Step 2:- Write the number '25' next to the number from first step= 4225

examples.example1:
Suppose we want to find the square of 75
Here last digit is ’5′ and left part is '7'
Step 1:- Multiply left part to left part plus one: 7 X (7+1) = 56

Step 2:- Write 56 and 25 together i.e. 5625

examples.example2:
Suppose we want to find the square of 115
Here last digit is '5' and left part is '11'
Step 1:- Multiply left part to left part plus one: 11 X (11+1) = 132

Step 2:- Write 132 and 25 together i.e. 13225
